timeline.bodyText: You can just name this annette
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: Are you sure this wrong? It seemed correct when i tested it, though it's possible i was mistaken.
timeline.author: dekvall

replies.bodyText: It's not wrong, it's just that the fish shoal stay tagged even when you collect the loot. The fish shoal only become untagged when they are adjacent to a drift net that is not actively catching (= full, unset) or when they have been tagged for a certain amount of ticks, which I was unable to determine but would seem to be somewhere randomly between 40 and 100.
replies.author: bartpeeters

replies.bodyText: Alright, how did you time the ticks?
replies.author: dekvall

replies.bodyText: I added an overlay to the fish shoal which showed the tick it was tagged (value of taggedFish).
replies.author: bartpeeters

replies.bodyText: I agree with all the other comments, do I add these changes in new commit(s) or do I amend the current commits?
replies.author: bartpeeters

replies.bodyText: I get that, but i was more interested in how you determined when a shoal was no longer tagged? Was it when it moved away from the net, or just didn't move towards it for example?
replies.author: dekvall

replies.bodyText: I'd prefer it if you amend your current commits :)
replies.author: dekvall

replies.bodyText:
Visually when a shoal was 2 or less tiles away from a drift net but did not go in it. Which means it was probably untagged for a longer time, but just never moved close enough to a net. That's why it's hard to determine how many ticks exactly it takes for a shoal to become untagged. But in this implementation it seldomly happens that a tagged shoal is actually not tagged.
Maybe if you have some time to test this implementation you can determine what causes a shoal which seems to be tagged to not actually be. It does not happen very often so I was unable to determine this case. It could be just a tick timeout or something else.
replies.author: bartpeeters

replies.bodyText: No i trust you, i was mostly interested in how you did it because i had the same problem, it's very hard to determine. Sounds good.
replies.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: This can just be a method of DriftNet
timeline.author: dekvall
dekvall

timeline.bodyText: 60 seconds is a very long time, i might have undershot the correct time with 6 seconds but what's the motivation for a tenfold increase?
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: Why do we care about the net status of the previous tick?
timeline.author: dekvall

replies.bodyText: When a fish shoal is 2 tiles adjacent to a drift net and is moving to a net that is just being setup it will be denied even though the net is currently in the CATCHING status. The easiest solution seemed to be to just look to the previous tick.
replies.author: bartpeeters

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be better if adjacentTiles was just a set, which would let you do adjacentTiles.contains(fishpoint)
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: It feels like this entire thing can be reduced to a method that takes an npc which would let you utilize the removeIf below, and not have to create additional iterators.
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: remove this on game object despawn too
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: As mentioned below, i would make this a Set
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.message: Drift net plugin: Add option to tag Annette when no drift nets in inventory

timeline.bodyText: Use lombok @Setter instead, also a setter without an argument feels weird?
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this method is necessary
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we can increase this some if we are certain it's around 40-60 secs, 120 maybe?
timeline.author: dekvall

replies.bodyText: After getting another fishing level yesterday I feel like 60 is ideal. Almost never had a fish which was tagged which didn't actually was and seldomly had a fish which was untagged still go in a net. Which is better in my opinion than a fish who is tagged but actually isn't. At 100 this happens pretty often so I wouldn't go higher than this.
replies.author: bartpeeters

timeline.bodyText: can just be tagAnnette imo
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: Could use ImmutableSet
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: remove this newline
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: i was thinking that this could go in a method too so you could use the removeIf below in a removeIf(expired || closeToUnsetNet) (naming idk)
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: could probably be just wasNotAcceptingFish and a comment
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: This will be the same as the current status unless there has been a change this tick, so it might be worth considering setting this in onVarbitChanged instead? not sure.
timeline.author: dekvall

replies.bodyText: Don't really know how that would work. We would still need to make sure that the next tick after a VarbitChanged, the prevTickStatus would be the same as the current status.
replies.author: bartpeeters

timeline.message: Drift net plugin: Add option to tag Annette when no drift nets in inventory

timeline.author: Nightfirecat

replies.author: bartpeeters

replies.bodyText: NPCs are despawned via NpcDespawned events on game state changes.
replies.author: Nightfirecat

Remove this extra newline

Nightfirecat

timeline.bodyText: This can be inlined into checkFishNextToNet since it is so short. See my comment on that method

Nightfirecat

timeline.message: Drift net plugin: Add option to tag Annette when no drift nets in inventory
drift net: Highlight Annette when inventory has no nets

timeline.bodyText: This line is a little long, can we break it off somewhere? Also i think we should s/check/is/ in for both of these methods.
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: Since we don't actually care if we were or are accepting fish (.filter(net -> net.isNotAcceptingFish() || net.wasNotAcceptingFish())) maybe we should just combine this into one notAcceptingFish and put the comment here?
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: I think this can go outside?
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.bodyText: the notAcceptingNets wording is a little funky since we have *notAcceptingFish which in this case essentially is the same thing in this case, also it sounds like a boolean. Maybe something like closedNets(?) is better
timeline.author: dekvall

timeline.message: Drift net plugin: Add option to tag Annette when no drift nets in inventory
driftnet: Hightlight Annette when no nets in inventory

driftnet: Improve fish shoal highlighting

This commit increases the default highlight length for fish shoals as
they are often active for much longer than 10 ticks, and also untags
fish shoals more accurately when they are adjacent to nets which cannot
catch fish.

This commit increases the default highlight length for fish shoals as
they are often active for much longer than 10 ticks, and also untags
fish shoals more accurately when they are adjacent to nets which cannot
